Turbo Design
  • Spool
  • View page source

Spool

class turbodesign.spool.Spool(passage: Passage, massflow: float, rows=typing.List[turbodesign.bladerow.BladeRow], num_streamlines: int = 3, fluid: Solution = None, rpm: float = -1, massflow_constraint: MassflowConstraint = MassflowConstraint.MatchMassFlow)[source]
property adjust_streamlines: bool

Variable that determines whether or not to try and adjust the streamlines to balance massflow This can be a source of failure. Setting it to false may help with debugging.

Returns:

True = streamlines are adjusted after calculation; False = No changes in streamlines

Return type:

bool

calculate_streamline_curvature(row: BladeRow, t_radial: List[float] | ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[_ScalarType_co]])[source]

Called to calculate new streamline curvature

Parameters:

  • row (BladeRow) – blade row

  • t_radial (Union[List[float],npt.NDArray]) – normalized streamline radial locations

initialize_streamlines()[source]

Initialize streamline and compute the curvature. This function is called once

plot()[source]

Plots the hub, shroud, and all the streamlines

plot_velocity_triangles()[source]

Plots the velocity triangles for each blade row Made for turbines

set_blade_row_exit_angles(radius: Dict[int, List[float]], beta: Dict[int, List[float]], IsSupersonic: bool = False)[source]

Set the intended exit flow angles for the spool.

Useful if you already have a geometry that you want to simulate

You can set the values for each blade row or simply the inlet and exit

Parameters:

  • radius (np.ndarray) – Matrix containing [[r1,r2,r3],[r1,r2,r3]] blade_rows x radial locations

  • beta (Dict[int,List[float]]) – Metal Angle of the geometry, it is assumed that the fluid will leave at this angle.

  • IsSupersonic (bool) – if solution is supersonic at spool exit

Example

# Station 0 has angles of [73.1,74.2,75.4] # Station 5 has angles of [69,69,69] beta = {0: [73.1,74.2,75.4], 5: [69,69,69]}

set_blade_row_rpm(index: int, rpm: float)[source]

sets the rpm of a particular blade row

set_blade_row_type(blade_row_index: int, rowType: RowType)[source]

Sets a blade row to be a different type.

Parameters:

blade_row_index (int) – Index of blade row. Keep in mind Blade row 0 is inlet, -1 = outlet
